title: Session_state of a widget is inconsistent with its display

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [x] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

When running code that are reached via the "pages" folder, a widget's session state can become inconsistent with its displayed value.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
Create the following structure

|- main.py
|- check_key_state.py
|- pages
   | - check_key_state_page.py

>>> main.py
import streamlit as st


st.title('In main page')

>>> pages/check_key_state_page.py
import check_key_state


check_key_state.main()

>>> check_key_state.py
import streamlit as st


def main():
    st.title("Check session state")

    st.caption(f"Streamlit version: {st.__version__}")

    layout_mode = st.segmented_control('layout mode', 
                                       ["layout1", "layout2"], 
                                       selection_mode='single', 
                                       default='layout1')

    if layout_mode == "layout1":
        layout1()
    elif layout_mode == "layout2":
        layout2()


def layout1():
    st.subheader("layout1")
    r = st.radio("Select a value", ["A", "B", "C"], horizontal=True, key="_radio")
    st.write(f"radio value: {r}, state value: {st.session_state['_radio']}")


def layout2():
    st.subheader("layout2")
    st.write(f"state value: {st.session_state['_radio']}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

### Steps To Reproduce

1. `streamlit run main.py`
2. Click on `check key state page` in the sidebar
3. Choose some value other than `A`, say `B`
4. Choose `layout2`
5. See that the state value is `B`
6. Choose `layout1` again
7. See that the app now displays `A`, but the state value is `B`

For example,

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad2d09e2-16ca-44c0-ac6e-b433f063dea0)

However, if you do `streamlit run check_key_state.py` directly, then this inconsistency issue does not come up. Unfortunately, in this case the choice `B` is forgotten.

### Expected Behavior

Session state and display should be consistent.

### Current Behavior

Session state and display are inconsistent.

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.44.1
- Python version: 3.10
- Operating System: Linux & Windows
- Browser: Edge


### Additional Information

I actually prefer the new behavior where the session state value is preserved (i.e. the choice of B is retained) upon a redraw. This is a great improvement, if only the display is consistent with the internal value. Thank you.

Note: when I say this used to work in a previous version (1.43.2), I meant that the display and state were consistent, not that the choice was retained (it wasn't).
